element: Profile attributes (age range, gender, declared location, language settings)
notes: Included in the Article 40 secure workspace; exports require vetting and aggregation of sensitive cohorts.

element: Feed interactions with ranking metadata (story_id, surface, dwell_time)
notes: Delivered as fact tables with 48-hour delay; contains per-impression logs for risk investigations.

element: Ad Library creative, spend, and targeting descriptors
notes: Accessible through the Ad Library API and CSV downloads; spend buckets widen below €1K per campaign.

element: User reports and enforcement queues by policy vertical
notes: Published quarterly in Widely Viewed Content and Community Standards reports with country-level breakdowns.

element: Integrity risk tier and behavior scores
notes: Model outputs are shared with confidence intervals and version metadata to support systemic risk reviews.

element: Civic and demographic panels linked to account cohorts
notes: Supplemental segments sourced from data brokers; aggregated to preserve differential privacy thresholds.

element: Creator category declarations and verified organization status
notes: CSV exports list creator self-identification, follower counts, and monetization eligibility.

element: Video performance metrics (views, completion rate, shares) with region flags
notes: Article 40 workspace delivers per-video metrics with synthetic identifiers for cross-table joins.

element: User reports and appeal outcomes for safety incidents
notes: Requires additional integrity justification; sensitive appeal notes are redacted until cases close.

element: Recommendation scores from the For You classifier
notes: Shared as probabilistic outputs with model versioning, feature importance, and calibration metrics.

element: Political and issue ad transparency archive
notes: Accessible through the TikTok Research API with rate limits; includes spend bands and advertiser certification.

element: Watch history aggregates (impressions, average view duration, signed-out share)
notes: The YouTube Researcher Program surfaces de-identified session metrics with configurable content filters.

element: Ads Transparency Center political inventory
notes: Provides creative assets, spend ranges, and targeting information for campaigns across the EU.

element: Viewer personalization segments (interests, retention clusters)
notes: Shared as bucketed probabilities; sensitive cohorts require aggregation to 10k+ users before export.

element: Query impression counts and click-through rates by topic
notes: Google Trends and Search Console APIs deliver normalized indexes (0–100) with support for EU regional filters.

element: Ads Transparency Center enforcement metrics
notes: Biannual PDF and CSV releases covering removals, advertiser suspensions, and policy appeals by member state.

element: Ads Safety partner datasets (malware domains, sanctioned entities)
notes: Shared under strict NDA in the Article 40 workspace to support investigations into delegated harms.

element: Account metadata (creation date, verified type, declared location)
notes: Accessible for historical data via 2022 API archives; current program offers limited metadata for approved projects.

element: Tweet engagement streams (impressions, likes, reposts) with language tags
notes: Article 40 extracts supplied as hourly aggregates after Trust & Safety review of the research proposal.

element: Platform-generated authenticity and bot likelihood scores
notes: Removed from public datasets in 2023; researchers must request access via competent authorities under the DSA.

element: Account profile metadata (bio text, server code of conduct, verification links)
notes: All ActivityPub instances expose JSON endpoints with pagination and server-level rate limiting.

element: Timeline events (posts, boosts, favourites) with moderation flags
notes: Available through streaming and REST APIs; moderation decisions are logged in server transparency dashboards.

element: Pin impressions and saves by content label
notes: Quarterly reporting provides aggregate safety and civic integrity statistics across EU member states.

element: Public Story metadata (creator type, discover channel, audience tiers)
notes: Snap publishes CSV appendices detailing creator categories and enforcement actions by region.

element: Spotlight engagement metrics (views, shares, watch time)
notes: Available via secure workspace in partnership with EDMO nodes for systemic risk monitoring.

element: Subreddit submissions and comments with moderation labels
notes: Pushshift-hosted archives provide historical coverage; current API requires OAuth and elevated researcher access.

element: Economic Graph attributes (industry, company size, geography)
notes: Published through the LinkedIn Economic Graph Research portal with downloadable aggregates.

element: Feed interactions and job application funnels by cohort
notes: Available under NDA via Microsoft research partnerships aligned with Article 40 systemic risk studies.

element: App safety flags and malware detection results shared with search and ads teams
notes: DSA risk reporting details enforcement against malicious apps impacting recommender systems.

element: Video-level watch time with completion rate, surface, and region
notes: Available through the Article 40 workspace export jobs; refreshed every 24 hours with per-video aggregates including traffic source metadata.

element: Content authenticity and coordinated behavior scores
notes: Risk model outputs joined to creator accounts; includes score version, threshold, and downstream enforcement outcome flags.

element: Top queries and impressions from YouTube Search and recommendations
notes: Accessible via YouTube Data API v3; requires developer key and enforces per-endpoint quota units.

element: Search Console aggregated query metrics for news and civic topics
notes: Shared through Search Console bulk export; provides click and impression trends split by country and device.

element: Trusted flagger escalations and subsequent policy outcomes
notes: Delivered in quarterly CSV releases to approved researchers with per-country breakdowns and response time metadata.

element: Public issue and political ad archive with spend, impressions, and targeting
notes: Bulk CSV published on the Snap Transparency hub; includes creative thumbnails and funding entity disclosures.
